subject: Technology
title: Surveillance Capitalism: You Are the Product
description: A 60-second lesson on Surveillance Capitalism: You Are the Product.

hook.text: If you're not paying for the product, you are the product. Your attention and data are what social media sells.

buildup.text: Shoshana Zuboff coined 'surveillance capitalism' to describe how companies harvest personal data for profit.

discovery.text: Every click, scroll, pause, and search is collected, analyzed, and sold to advertisers who bid to reach you.

twist.text: The data isn't just for ads. It builds predictive models of your behavior, sometimes more accurate than your own self-knowledge.

climax.text: Surveillance capitalism generates over $200 billion annually. Your private life is the raw material of a massive industry.

punchline.text: Free social media costs you something far more valuable: your privacy.

quiz.question: What is surveillance capitalism?
options: Companies harvesting personal data to predict behavior and sell to advertisers
